net.derquinse.bocas
Class MultiServiceGuavaCacheBuilder

java.lang.Object
  net.derquinse.bocas.MultiServiceGuavaCacheBuilder

public final class MultiServiceGuavaCacheBuilder
extends Object

Builder for a Guava-based cache for multiple services.

Author:
Andres Rodriguez.

Method Detail

maximumSize

public MultiServiceGuavaCacheBuilder maximumSize(long size)
Specifies the maximum number of entries the cache may contain. Note that the cache may evict an entry before this limit is exceeded.

When size is zero, elements will be evicted immediately after being loaded into the cache. This can be useful in testing, or to disable caching temporarily without a code change.

Parameters:
size - the maximum size of the cache
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if size is negative
IllegalStateException - if a maximum size was already set
IllegalStateException - if the service has already been built

maximumWeight

public MultiServiceGuavaCacheBuilder maximumWeight(long weight)
Specifies the maximum weight of entries the cache may contain. The weight of an entry is the number of bytes of its value.

Note that the cache may evict an entry before this limit is exceeded.

When weight is zero, elements will be evicted immediately after being loaded into cache. This can be useful in testing, or to disable caching temporarily without a code change.

Note that weight is only used to determine whether the cache is over capacity; it has no effect on selecting which entry should be evicted next.

Parameters:
weight - the maximum weight the cache may contain
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if size is negative
IllegalStateException - if a maximum size was already set
IllegalStateException - if the service has already been built

expireAfterAccess

public MultiServiceGuavaCacheBuilder expireAfterAccess(long duration,
                                                       TimeUnit unit)
Specifies that each entry should be automatically removed from the cache once a fixed duration has elapsed after the entry's creation, the most recent replacement of its value, or its last access.

When duration is zero, this method hands off to maximumSize (0), ignoring any otherwise-specificed maximum size or weight. This can be useful in testing, or to disable caching temporarily without a code change.

Parameters:
duration - the length of time after an entry is last accessed that it should be automatically removed
unit - the unit that duration is expressed in
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if duration is negative
IllegalStateException - if the time to idle or time to live was already set
IllegalStateException - if the service has already been built

direct

public MultiServiceGuavaCacheBuilder direct()
Specifies the cache will use direct values.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the service has already been built

build

public MultiServiceGuavaCache build()
Builds a cache.

Returns:
The caching repository.
